Failure Theme: none material—no cut-offs, no irregular masonry, no unreadable device-frame collage dominating. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 1’s disciplined card grid; not as complex as Exemplar 5’s large system but well executed. Score Justification: Cohesive grid, harmonized assets, and steady rhythm across multiple rows merit a 4.

color.explanation: Observations: (1) Off‑white page background with off‑black text creates gentle contrast; (2) Cards use varied pastel/earthy mats (lavender, moss, ochre, pink, sage) with controlled saturation; (3) Status chips and nav pill use muted neutrals; (4) Screenshots sit comfortably on colored mats without value clashes. Reconstruction: Neutrals appear tuned (no harsh #000/#fff); accents are distributed via card mats rather than loud UI chrome; shadows are subtle and consistent. Link/State Audit: Active nav pill adds a quiet accent; inline links are understated and consistent. Consistency Map: repeated pastel mats across all project cards; identical neutral chips; same off‑white page shell and subdued footer; color values of mats kept within a narrow brightness band to avoid flicker. Failure Theme: none—no mismatched whites or noisy logo rows. Anchor Comparison: Close to Exemplar 1; more varied mats than Exemplar 19 but still harmonious; less expressive than Exemplar 5’s brand palette. Score Justification: Controlled, harmonious palette that unifies diverse thumbnails earns a strong 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: Clean sans family throughout; large bold H1 in hero with comfortable measure; small gray meta line; project cards show a consistent three-line stack (client label with icon, title, short descriptor). Rounding and spacing around the portrait and cards preserves baseline stability. Reconstruction: Type Scale appears to use 4–5 steps—H1 (display), H3-style card titles, small section labels, body/meta; leading ~1.35–1.5 produces airy but controlled rhythm; sentence case is consistent; no widows/orphans visible; baselines between card headings and descriptions are even. Link/State Audit: Top-right nav shows an active state (Home darker) vs dormant (About/Resume lighter); card tiles likely link but explicit underline/hover states aren’t visible—states are implied, not proven. Consistency Map: (1) Section labels (Selected Works, Past Projects) use the same small-size/weight treatment; (2) Card headings share size/weight and spacing; (3) Meta lines use the same lighter gray tone; (4) Sentence case and punctuation are consistent across hero, cards, and nav. Failure Theme: Strong but conservative hierarchy; limited proof of link/hover/visited treatments keeps it from feeling typographically expressive. Anchor Comparison: Closer to Exemplar 6 and 16 than to Exemplar 8—more disciplined rhythm and labeling than Exemplar 8; less expressive scale/interaction states and voice than Exemplar 6/16 (fewer levels, no evident underline tuning, limited link states). Score Justification: Multi-level hierarchy, good measures, and consistent labels across multiple sections justify a 4; absence of visible state details and limited evidence keep it below 5.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Two-column hero (left copy, right portrait) balances well with ample negative space; Selected Works and Past Projects form disciplined 2x2 and 1x2 card grids; gutters are even horizontally and vertically; card radii and internal mats match across tiles; image crops are clean and readable. Reconstruction: Grid appears to use a centered container with equal outer margins; consistent card widths and identical heights per row; spacing system reads as 8px multiples; captions align left and lock to card edges; portrait corner radius matches card radius establishing a system. Link/State Audit: Navigation is clear and placed predictably; cards read as clickable through consistent mats and shadows, though explicit hover isn’t shown. Consistency Map: (1) Identical card radii and shadows; (2) Even 2-column rhythm across both rows; (3) Headline-to-grid spacing mirrors grid-to-footer spacing; (4) Consistent caption placement and client icon positioning. Failure Theme: Safe structure with little experimentation; layout novelty is low but execution is crisp. Anchor Comparison: Cleaner and more unified than Exemplar 8 (looser spacing and less consistent tiles); not as complex or point-of-view-driven as Exemplar 5/6 (fewer structures and interactions shown). Score Justification: Strong rhythm and asset handling across multiple sections merits a 4; lack of complex structures or breakpoint variety keeps it from 5.

color.explanation: Observations: Off-white page background with tuned grays for text; black-and-white portrait reduces palette noise; project cards use low-chroma pastel mats (blue, cream, blush, light gray) that unify varied screenshots; subtle, consistent shadows/borders. Reconstruction: Unification & State Logic—neutral shell (near-black text, cool grays) supports soft card mats; accents are sparse and role-based (client icons/logos, illustrations within cards); value hierarchy is controlled—no harsh #000/#fff pairings or bright default blues. Link/State Audit: Nav relies on value contrast (active vs inactive) rather than color; links within body aren’t visible in this view. Consistency Map: (1) Pastel mats share value range; (2) Shadow/border treatment is uniform; (3) Neutral text colors are consistent across hero, labels, and cards; (4) No noisy multicolor logo rows—client marks stay small and contained. Failure Theme: Conservative palette with limited state demonstration; a slightly more saturated orange tile in Past Projects nudges the range but remains contained. Anchor Comparison: More harmonized than Exemplar 8 (which shows clashing content hues); less nuanced than Exemplar 6/16 where states and tints are more explicitly systematized. Score Justification: Harmonious, tuned neutrals and unifying mats across multiple tiles justify a 4; lack of explicit state color logic keeps it from 5.

typography.explanation: Observations: Single, calm serif used throughout; intro paragraph has comfortable leading and measure; each role block shows a consistent trio—company/role, small italic dates, body copy; subdued nav at top right and an orange email link at the bottom. Preflight: no sloppy image cues, no default blue/underline, no template boilerplate beyond a conventional intro line. Reconstruction (Type Scale): Display name mark at top left; body paragraph ~60–75ch with ~1.5 line height; company/role acts as H3, dates as secondary micro‑label in italic; buttons are small‑caps/Title‑case with matched letter‑spacing. Hierarchy comes from size + tone (roman vs italic) rather than just weight. Link/State Audit: Links are styled via a warm accent (email) and outlined pill CTAs (“View work”) that repeat across every section; no harsh default underline. Consistency Map: (1) Identical date style and placement across all roles, (2) repeated pill CTA style, (3) uniform paragraph spacing and rag, (4) identical company/role heading treatment. Failure Theme: none major; hierarchy is restrained but clear. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 16 (Gavin Nelson) for editorial minimal craft—similar disciplined labels and consistent CTAs. Compared to that anchor, this page is slightly less expressive (fewer type sizes and states) but equally tidy. Score Justification: Strong editorial minimal voice with consistent hierarchy and readable rhythm across multiple role sections; safe‑harbor applies, supporting a 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: A single, narrow content column with generous side gutters; each experience block uses the same vertical spacing and a subtle left marker; dates align as a right‑hand micro‑column opposing the company/role line; nav is quiet and right‑aligned. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): One main text column (~640–720px) with a two‑lane line on the first row of each entry (company/role left, date right), then full‑width body copy; spacing follows an 8–12pt rhythm; CTAs sit on their own baseline keeping a clean scan path. Image handling N/A (textual page), but elements maintain consistent insets and margins. Link/State Audit: Repeated pill CTAs provide clear affordance and consistent placement below each description; top‑nav uses a balanced inline list. Consistency Map: (1) Identical entry construction across six roles, (2) uniform CTA placement, (3) stable left margin and baseline rhythm, (4) footer social icons centered and evenly spaced. Failure Theme: none significant; the page is intentionally sparse and controlled. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 16’s ordered list layout—this one is comparably disciplined though with fewer modules. Score Justification: Clear, repeatable structure with disciplined spacing and alignment; editorial minimal safe‑harbor supports a 4.

color.explanation: Observations: Neutral off‑white background with near‑black text; gray micro‑labels for dates; warm orange accent used sparingly for the email link; CTAs use a subtle gray outline instead of filled color. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Palette is monochrome + one warm accent; neutrals feel tuned (no harsh #000/#fff); accents appear only for key links; outline buttons avoid extra hues, keeping the page quiet. Link/State Audit: Accent color signals the email link; CTAs rely on outline shape and placement rather than a second accent; explicit hover/visited states not shown but role logic is clear. Consistency Map: (1) Same neutral text color across sections, (2) identical gray for dates and outlines, (3) single accent reserved for the contact link. Failure Theme: Color is intentionally minimal; limited opportunity to demonstrate unification against diverse imagery. Anchor Comparison: Compared to Exemplar 16, this uses a similarly restrained palette but shows fewer state treatments and variations. Score Justification: Solid, coherent minimal palette with clear accent role, but limited depth of color/state craft visible, so keep at 3.

typography.explanation: Observations: Large display hero “Hi, I’m Rajat” with color/weight contrast; readable intro paragraph (~55–65ch); small meta label “Featured Projects”; left project list uses scale and tint to indicate active item; footer uses very large display type. Preflight: sloppy cues=1 (unreadable tiny UI inside the Kredey device collage); template cues=2 (“Hi, I’m [Name]” hero; billboard‑style “Let’s Connect”). Reconstruction (Type Scale): Single grotesk family; H1 very large (~96–120); H2 list items (~40–48); body around 16–18px with ~1.45–1.6 leading; micro‑label for canvas; punctuation shows an en dash in “cross–functional.” Link/State Audit: Links likely red (e.g., NDA Protected) and pill CTAs, but underline weight/offset and hover/visited states are not evidenced. Consistency Map: consistent single family, repeated coral red for emphasis (hero name, active project, canvas title, footer); pill button style repeats. Failure Theme: templated hero language, minimal link/state craft, and some low‑contrast de‑emphasis in the project list reduce refinement. Anchor Comparison: Closest to candidate_33 (all 3s). Compared to stronger anchors (exemplar_6/exemplar_11), this lacks tuned neutrals, underline customization, and cross‑page rhythm proof. Score Justification: Readable with clear hierarchy, but missing state/link polish and micro‑craft signals, so baseline 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Clear sectioning—hero, a two‑column "Featured Projects" split (left list, right visual), a large dotted‑grid canvas card with rounded corners, and a bold red footer with CTAs. Ample whitespace and centered main column. Preflight: sloppy cues=1 (tiny unreadable UI within the Kredey collage); template cues=2 (standard intro hero; billboard footer). Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Likely 2‑column content area with wide gutter; consistent left alignment for text blocks; generous vertical spacing; footer has strong container with rounded top and symmetrical paddings. Link/State Audit: CTAs are clearly discoverable in the footer; project list hints at a nav‑like interaction but only one project tile is shown; no proof of section‑to‑section state handling. Consistency Map: repeated rounded containers (canvas card, footer), repeated left alignment, consistent spacing rhythm between hero, projects, and canvas. Failure Theme: device‑frame collage with small unreadable screenshots; limited evidence of long grid discipline or harmonized mats/captions across multiple project tiles; billboard footer dominates visual weight. Anchor Comparison: Closest to candidate_33 (layout 3). Compared to higher anchors (exemplar_5/exemplar_11), this lacks harmonized asset handling and multi‑tile rhythm proof. Score Justification: Solid, readable structure with conventional patterns; some asset handling roughness and limited breadth keep it at 3.

color.explanation: Observations: Strong coral‑red accent used for the hero name, active project, section header, and the entire footer; primary neutrals are white background and near‑black text; light gray de‑emphasis for inactive project names; a purple project tile introduces additional hue. Preflight: sloppy cues=1 (tiny UI); template cues=2; no mismatched whites or heavy shadows detected. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Accent red drives emphasis and CTAs (white pills on red); links appear red but states (hover/visited) are not evidenced; neutrals seem close to pure #000/#fff without tuned grays. Link/State Audit: CTA buttons contrast well; link state logic beyond color is unproven. Consistency Map: coral accent repeats across hero, project selection, canvas label, and footer; white/black shell is consistent; buttons are consistently white on red. Failure Theme: limited neutral tuning and no visible mats/border tints to unify screenshots—purple project visual stands apart; large value jump in the footer is intentional but underscores the lack of subtle neutral work. Anchor Comparison: Closest to candidate_33 (color 3). Stronger anchors (exemplar_6/exemplar_11) show tuned grays and unifying mats; those are missing here. Score Justification: Cohesive accent use but otherwise default‑leaning neutrals and limited state logic—competent baseline 3.

typography.explanation: Observations: 1) Large bold H1 “Hey, I’m Robin” paired with a right‑column intro; 2) Secondary H2 “Nice to meet you” with multi‑paragraph body; 3) Paragraph measure looks ~60–70ch with ~1.5 leading; 4) Small nav links (Hello, Work) and a light footer note. Reconstruction: Type scale appears to use a common geometric sans (likely Inter/Helvetica). H1~48–56, H2~32, body ~16; sentence case, solid contrast, stable rag. Baseline rhythm between heading, body, and footer feels even with consistent paragraph spacing. Link/State Audit: Only a single inline link (“resume”) plus top‑right nav; link style looks default underline/blue with no visible hover/visited states—state system not demonstrated. Consistency Map: Repeated treatment of heavy headings, regular body copy, centered logo + small nav, and consistent paragraph spacing across hero/about/footer. Failure Theme: Generic system sans + default‑ish link styling; little evidence of tuned link underlines, optical alignment, or distinctive type voice. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are Exemplar 11 (Sally; overall 2.65) and Calibration Example 17 (candidate_33; overall 3.0). Like those, hierarchy is clear but generic; fewer proof points than candidate_33 and no project tiles to stress the system. Score Justification: Readable and orderly but template‑scent and missing state/micro‑craft proof cap the score at 3 (also Single‑view evidence).

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: 1) Two‑column hero with strong left headline and right intro block; 2) Second two‑column section with left copy and a right portrait photo; 3) Generous gutters and consistent left margins; 4) Simple footer band with aligned social icons. Reconstruction: Single wide container, 2‑column grid with ample outer padding; vertical rhythm between sections is even and whitespace is controlled; image sits on the grid with comfortable mat and no cropped edges. Link/State Audit: Primary navigation is minimal (Hello, Work) with no visible active/hover; CTA placement is conventional and unobtrusive. Consistency Map: Repeated 2‑column structure, identical section paddings, consistent left alignment for copy blocks, and stable spacing before/after headings across hero/about/footer. Failure Theme: Template two‑column intro page—no project gallery, no complex asset handling, and minimal evidence of harmonized mats/radii beyond the single photo. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 11 (Sally) but with even less content variety; below Exemplar 9/14 class sites that show robust grid discipline across multiple tiles. Score Justification: Clean and consistent but generic with limited complexity; template cues cap at 3 and Single‑view evidence prevents higher.

color.explanation: Observations: 1) Off‑white page background with near‑black text; 2) Subtle light‑gray footer band; 3) Only color comes from the portrait photo; 4) Inline link likely uses a default blue underline (no state proof). Reconstruction: Neutral shell relies on grayscale hierarchy; accents are not defined beyond potential default link blue; no tinted borders/shadows visible. Link/State Audit: Links present but hover/visited states are not demonstrated; CTA role/color logic is absent. Consistency Map: Same off‑white base across sections, consistent black/gray text values, and restrained use of color confined to imagery and possibly links. Failure Theme: Serviceable but default‑ish palette with no demonstrated unification tactics or state logic. Anchor Comparison: Close to Exemplar 11 (Sally)—conservative neutrals, minimal accent strategy. Score Justification: Harmonious and quiet with no clashes, but too generic and state‑light to merit 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: Hero uses a confident grotesk with mixed weights; bold emphasis on key phrases with yellow highlights. Section H2 'I worked on…' and testimonial cards show consistent left‑aligned hierarchy and comfortable body copy. Footer retains the same system. Reconstruction: Type Scale ≈ H1 48–56px tight leading; H2 ~24–28px; body ~16–18px with ~1.5 line-height; small meta for titles/roles. Hierarchy uses size + weight, not just bold; body measure is within readable bounds. Baseline rhythm between headings, paragraphs, and cards is even. Link/State Audit: CTAs use a consistent small‑capsule button with arrow; inline links in the intro appear styled (not default blue). Consistency Map: (1) Repeated CTA chip style across project tiles, (2) consistent name/role treatment in testimonials, (3) repeated emphasis style (bold + yellow underline/marker) in hero and section headers. Failure Theme: Minor noisiness from multiple bold fragments in the hero and slightly tight leading at display size; no link state proof beyond CTAs. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 19 and Exemplar 1—clean, product‑leaning voice; not as surgically tuned as top anchors (fewer micro‑details like underline offset/visited states). Score Justification: Clear, readable system with consistent hierarchy and few defects merits a 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Page is structured into hero, a projects section with large tiles, a testimonial grid (2×2), logo strip, and footer. Spacing rhythm and card radii are consistent; CTAs align bottom-left on tiles. Preflight Checklist: sloppy cues ≥3 present—(1) first project shows an angled laptop where UI text is unreadable at the presented size, (2) second project uses small phone renders with unreadable UI, (3) third project again with tiny device UI and partial crop at bottom. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Single centered container, predictable vertical spacing, uniform card mats and 12–16px radii; testimonial cards align well with even gutters. Link/State Audit: CTAs consistently placed and styled; scan path from tile image to CTA is predictable. Consistency Map: (1) Unified card mats/shadows, (2) identical CTA chips on every project, (3) testimonial cards share the same padding, corners, and caption layout. Failure Theme: Device‑mock collage with tiny, unreadable screenshots undermines asset communication. Anchor Comparison: Closer to Exemplar 8/11 but below them due to repeated unreadable mock imagery; far from Exemplar 1/5 where screenshots are legible and harmonized. Score Justification: Due to sloppy_images red flag, Layout is capped at ≤2; despite otherwise tidy grid, asset handling warrants the cap.

color.explanation: Observations: Off‑white hero with light confetti, black text, and a single yellow highlight accent; projects sit on very light gray mats; testimonials on a warm beige section; footer returns to light neutral. No harsh #000/#fff contrast and no noisy multicolor sections. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Neutral shell (soft whites/beiges) unifies varied imagery; accent yellow appears in marker highlights and small decorative stars; CTAs use a neutral chip with a subtle accent arrow—roles are clear and restrained. Link/State Audit: Buttons are consistent and clearly distinguishable from body text; inline links appear subdued, avoiding default blue. Consistency Map: (1) Yellow highlight motif (hero and section header copy), (2) consistent pale mats around work tiles, (3) warm neutral background for the testimonial band to separate content without jarring value jumps. Failure Theme: Slight busyness from confetti texture in the hero, but it doesn’t cause value flicker across the grid. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 1/19—controlled neutrals with a single accent; not as refined as Exemplar 5’s deep systemization but comfortably strong. Score Justification: Harmonious palette with clear accent strategy merits a 4.

typography.explanation:
Observations: Large left‑aligned section nameplates (e.g., “Column”, “Webflow Brand”, “Samsung”) set in a modern grotesk with tight tracking and clean rags. Small meta rows under each section use a lighter tone and smaller size, with consistent separators; tiny circular ML labels repeat with identical sizing and baseline alignment. Nav (top‑right) is restrained and optically balanced with the hero space. No default-blue links or thick default underlines visible; no widows/orphans.
Reconstruction: Type Scale appears disciplined—H1/section headers ~80–96px, sub/meta ~12–14px, body ~16px equivalents with ~1.4–1.6 leading. Single-family voice throughout; hierarchy uses size + weight + tone, not just bold. Baseline rhythm across headers/meta/tiles remains stable section to section.
Link/State Audit: Links are understated and likely custom (no default underline/blue present in visible areas). Navigation and section labels keep consistent tone and hover affordances are implied by the disciplined system.
Consistency Map: (1) Identical section headers and spacing treatment across all rows; (2) Meta label rows (light gray, compact leading) repeated; (3) Circular ML badges with consistent size/baseline; (4) Uniform nav scale/weight across the page.
Failure Theme: None evident; no template defaults, no mixed fonts or casing drift.
Anchor Comparison: Closest anchors are Exemplar 5 and 16. This page matches Exemplar 5’s refined editorial tone and surpasses 16 in visible scale discipline and section header craft. Deltas vs weaker anchors (e.g., Exemplar 8): tighter scale, non-default links, and steadier rhythm.
Score Justification: Clear multi-modal hierarchy, stable rhythm, tuned scale across many sections. No preflight issues; merits 5.

layout_composition.explanation:
Observations: Each project section renders a strict multi-column tile grid with identical gutters and consistent tile ratios; vertical rhythm between header/meta and grid is repeatable. No cut-off crops; cards align to a shared container width; long page keeps alignment tight across all sections. The sticky-note hero leaves abundant negative space and centers focus without crowding the grid below. Thin section dividers and spacing create a clear scan path.
Reconstruction: Likely a 12-col grid resolved into 3-up/4-up tile matrices with even gutters (8/12 multiples). Consistent internal mats (mostly edge-to-edge tiles with unified radii—appearing square) and no device-frame clutter. Section left labels with ML badges align to the same vertical grid as tile blocks; captions/metas are consistently placed.
Link/State Audit: Clickable tiles are implied by consistent image cards; headings/meta act as predictable anchors. No floaty CTAs; everything respects the grid.
Consistency Map: (1) Repeated 3×N tile matrices with identical gutters; (2) Header/meta stack spacing identical per section; (3) Left rail ML badge + metadata repeats; (4) Section-to-section container width remains constant.
Failure Theme: None; no masonry rag, no container drift, no template modules telegraphing boilerplate.
Anchor Comparison: Very close to Exemplar 5 (which this strongly resembles) and stronger than Exemplar 17 in rhythm and asset handling. Compared to generic grids, this shows finer control in gutters and sectional pacing.
Score Justification: Long-page structure holds with immaculate rhythm and harmonized assets; qualifies for a 5.

color.explanation:
Observations: Shell uses calm off-white with near-black text; section dividers are subtle. Tile imagery spans purples, cyans, charcoal, and occasional light panels, yet sections group hues so rows feel cohesive. The hero sticky note uses a gentle warm orange with a soft, natural shadow that doesn’t clash with the colder brand tones below.
Reconstruction: Neutral palette is tuned (not pure #000/#fff). Accents appear in imagery rather than chrome; state colors are conservative and consistent. No harsh default blue, and no saturated footers or random gradients in the shell. Value control keeps readability high; only minor value flicker from very dark vs light tiles across rows.
Link/State Audit: Link color treatments aren’t overtly shown, but the absence of default blue and the cohesive neutrals imply custom, restrained states consistent with the system.
Consistency Map: (1) Off-white background throughout; (2) Consistent neutral text color; (3) Subtle hairline dividers; (4) Imagery-led color clustered by project sections to maintain cohesion.
Failure Theme: Minor value flicker between highly saturated/dark tiles and lighter tiles; states are implied rather than explicitly demonstrated.
Anchor Comparison: Matches Exemplar 5’s approach—strong neutral shell with colorful work tiles; slightly less evidence of explicit state logic keeps it at 4 rather than 5.
Score Justification: Harmonious and controlled with tuned neutrals; small gaps in visible state proof and occasional value flicker keep it at a strong 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: Across the grid, project titles (e.g., FutureAdvisor, Streamloan, Strava) use a clean sans with a smaller gray meta line; top nav (WORK, ABOUT, RESUME) is small-caps/letterspaced with a centered wordmark. No long-form text shown. Reconstruction: Type Scale — clear steps: nav micro-labels < project titles < page metadata; spacing between title and meta is consistent; casing is mostly Title Case; measures are short and readable; leading appears around 1.4–1.6. Consistency — title/meta pair repeats under each tile; nav labels are uniform; footer social icons are restrained. Micro-craft — rags are tidy; no collisions or widows; however links/underline treatments aren’t demonstrated and punctuation/number alignment signals are absent. Link/State Audit: Link styling/state is not evident (no visible hover/visited or underline tuning); nav active state is not clearly indicated. Consistency Map: repeated title+meta pairs under all tiles; uniform nav style; consistent gutter between image and caption. Failure Theme: conservative, generic typographic system with limited evidence of custom link treatments or refined micro‑details. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 8 (similar sparse portfolio grid). Compared to that anchor, this page shows (1) less tuned link/CTA treatment, (2) smaller, lighter meta text that risks low contrast, (3) fewer proof points of rhythm across long copy. Score Justification: Readable and organized but generic; with single‑page evidence and missing state/link proof, baseline 3 is appropriate.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: A two-column gallery of mixed lifestyle/device photos with captions beneath; ample outer margins; final row has a single left-aligned tile (Strava). Several thumbnails include device frames with tiny, unreadable UI (desktop monitor, laptop+phone, Hipcamp laptop, Strava phone). Reconstruction: Grid/Spacing — simple two-column grid with even horizontal gutters and consistent caption alignment; vertical rhythm is acceptable. Asset handling lacks harmonization: no consistent internal mats or radii around images; photos vary widely in tone and context. Link/State Audit: Tiles likely clickable but there’s no card affordance, hover, or focus state shown; no caption alignment cues for interaction. Consistency Map: consistent two-column module; image above, title and meta below; repeated margins around the gallery. Failure Theme: device‑mock collage with tiny, unreadable UI and mixed photographic backgrounds; lack of harmonized mats causes rhythm/value flicker. Anchor Comparison: Nearest anchors are Exemplar 8 (cleaner unification via mats) and Exemplar 9 (disciplined card rhythm). Compared to them, this page has (1) multiple unreadable device mocks, (2) no image mat/radius system, (3) visual noise from mixed backgrounds. Score Justification: Preflight triggers sloppy_images due to multiple unreadable device mocks; by rule, Layout ≤ 2. Despite a stable grid, image handling and affordance gaps keep it at 2.

color.explanation: Observations: The shell is white with neutral black/gray text; color comes from heterogeneous photos (green plants, yellow sticky notes, brown wood, earthy leaves), producing visible value/hue jumps row to row. Reconstruction: Unification & State Logic — no evident accent system; links and CTAs don’t show a consistent color role; neutrals appear default-ish (#000 on #fff or close). Without mats/borders, vibrant photos dominate and the shell does little to unify them. Link/State Audit: No hover/active/visited color behavior is apparent in nav or tiles. Consistency Map: consistent gray meta line under titles; black titles; monochrome social icons. Failure Theme: value flicker from unbounded lifestyle imagery and lack of unifying mats/border tints or toned neutrals. Anchor Comparison: Exemplar 8 uses soft, controlled mats to harmonize screenshots; here (1) no mats or subtle borders unify content, (2) neutral palette seems untuned, (3) state/role colors are undefined. Score Justification: Preflight notes mismatched whites/mats causing value flicker; by rule Color ≤ 2. Overall palette remains serviceable but not unified, so 2 is warranted.

typography.explanation: Observations: Centered hero “Hello! I’m Dorna Mehrkish.” with short intro paragraph; repeated project cards each with a title and small gray description; black filled CTAs (“More projects”, “View resume”); small nav links top‑right. Across multiple cards the title/description stack is consistent and readable. Reconstruction: Type scale appears to use a single sans (Inter/Roboto‑like). H1 ~48–56px, card titles ~20–22px, body ~15–16px with ~1.5 leading; measures are comfortable and paragraphs stay within ~60–70ch. Hierarchy relies on size/weight shifts (H1 bold, card titles semi‑bold, body regular). Baseline rhythm across tiles is mostly stable. Link/State Audit: Links in the hero (“Pantheon”) look near‑default blue with minimal state treatment while CTAs are black pills, so link roles are not unified; card titles don’t clearly indicate link affordance. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated card module with same title/body scale, (2) consistent nav/link scale at top and footer, (3) uniform button style for the two CTAs. Failure Theme (Preflight cues): slight template scent via “I’m [Name]” hero and default‑ish link blue; an emoji tag inside a card (“Case Study Coming Soon!”) introduces tone inconsistency. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 8/19; unlike those, this page shows less tuned link styling and fewer micro‑craft touches (no customized underline/visited state, generic buttons). Score Justification: Clear, readable hierarchy meets baseline but limited evidence and lack of state polish keep it at 3 (single‑view cap applies).

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Two‑column staggered grid of project cards with generous gutters; each card uses a white panel with soft shadow placed on top of a large colored mat; several screenshots are small or inside a tilted device mock (e.g., Lendmate) and are not readable; Lyft tile is a brand block breaking content uniformity. Reconstruction: Centered container, likely 2 columns with ~40–48px gutters; vertical rhythm is uneven because card heights vary and are offset, creating ragged masonry edges. Asset handling favors small device mocks and collage‑style screenshots; radii appear consistent but shadows are generic. Link/State Audit: Cards likely clickable but affordance not reinforced; CTAs at the bottom align to grid but float as a separate section. Consistency Map: (1) repeated card frame (white panel + shadow + caption), (2) consistent radii across cards, (3) same two‑column structure from top to bottom. Failure Theme (Preflight cues): multiple small, unreadable UI screenshots across tiles (Autopilot, Updates, Time Off, Preboarding, Lendmate); value flicker from mixed colored mats; ragged vertical rhythm from masonry offsets. Anchor Comparison: Compared to Exemplar 19 or 8, this grid lacks readable asset sizing and has more value noise; those anchors keep larger, legible screenshots and steadier rows. Score Justification: Sloppy‑image threshold crossed, so Layout is capped at 2; grid is serviceable but asset readability and rhythm issues hold it below the competent 3.

color.explanation: Observations: Pastel mats (yellow, orange, green, purple, blue, pink) alternate behind white cards with shadows; text is black/gray; CTAs are black pills; hero link appears default blue. Reconstruction: Neutrals look near #fff/#111 with generic gray body; borders/shadows not hue‑tuned; no visible system for hover/visited states. Unification & State Logic: Multiple bright mats introduce competing hues without a harmonizing shell; CTAs use black which adds another strong value jump. Link/State Audit: Blue text links and black buttons represent different roles but with no clear state logic or hover cues shown. Consistency Map: (1) repeated use of colored mats per card, (2) consistent white card interior, (3) black CTA treatment reused in the closing section. Failure Theme (Preflight cues): value flicker from mismatched mats across the grid and a small device mock collage; neutrals feel default and do not unify the varied screenshots. Anchor Comparison: Exemplar 19 controls pastels with tighter values and neutral framing; Exemplar 8 also keeps backgrounds harmonized. Here the palette is louder and less controlled. Score Justification: Due to value flicker from mixed mats and lack of tuned neutrals/states, Color stays at 2; cap from sloppy_images applies.

typography.explanation: Observations: 1) Large, calm H1 “Hello, I’m Rasmus” with generous spacing; 2) Column heads and item titles use a clear size/weight step above body; 3) Body copy in all three columns reads ~55–65ch with ~1.45–1.6 leading; 4) Repeated micro‑labels (dates, “See all →” links) are consistently lighter and smaller; 5) Sentence‑case throughout, clean rags, no widows. Reconstruction (Type Scale): Display H1 (~2.5–3× body), list titles (~1.3–1.5×) with regular/semibold contrast, body around 14–16px with stable baseline rhythm, meta/dates one step down with reduced contrast. Links use an arrow suffix and color/weight shift instead of default underlines, preserving rhythm. Link/State Audit: Links consistently styled as grey/black text with trailing “→”; buttons on the right (“Buy a nice poster”) are distinct but harmonized, implying clear CTA vs link roles. Consistency Map: repeated item structure across Projects and Thoughts columns; identical meta/date placement and grey tone; uniform arrow link treatment across multiple rows; stable paragraph spacing across all columns. Failure Theme: none major; only limited evidence of hover/visited states in this single view. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 18 (Paco Coursey) and Exemplar 16 (Gavin Nelson): similar disciplined editorial system. Deltas: this page shows equally tuned measure/leading, consistent meta styling, and custom link treatment, but fewer visible states and fewer typographic voices than those anchors. Score Justification: Strong editorial minimal with disciplined rhythm and consistent link treatment merits 4; single‑view limits proof for 5.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: 1) Three‑column grid with even gutters and aligned baselines; 2) Left/right dark side gutters create a stable frame and clear focal center; 3) Repeated list rows align to the same vertical rhythm; 4) Sidebar actions (“Inter typeface family”, “Buy a nice poster”) align to the column grid and don’t float. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Likely 12‑col with three equal content columns and fixed outer margins; vertical spacing appears on an 8–12px multiple; consistent indent and hanging arrows for ‘See all’. Image handling is text‑first so no crop/radius mismatches; the few inline elements (badges) sit on the baseline. Link/State Audit: Primary scan path runs left→center→right; CTA buttons are grouped in the right column and visually distinct, maintaining hierarchy. Consistency Map: identical list item spacing across Projects and Thoughts; uniform column widths and gutters; repeated ‘See all →’ placement at column tails; stable margins to the dark gutters. Failure Theme: limited breakpoint evidence; only one viewport shown. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 18 and 16—editorial, grid‑driven layout with disciplined rhythm. Deltas: comparable column rhythm and framing; fewer complex asset harmonization challenges here than the anchors; similarly tight spacing control. Score Justification: Clear, consistent grid and rhythm with a point of view (side gutters) earns 4; single‑view breadth prevents a 5.

color.explanation: Observations: 1) Tuned neutrals dominate (off‑white canvas, off‑black text, soft greys for meta); 2) A single accent (small orange dot) provides identity without noise; 3) CTAs use restrained grey fills that harmonize with body text; 4) No mismatched whites or value flicker across columns. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Neutral shell unifies diverse content types (lists, buttons) without relying on heavy borders; accent reserved for a small brand mark; link/CTA roles separated by tone and the arrow device rather than bright colors. Link/State Audit: Links appear as high‑contrast text with arrow suffix; CTAs have a subtle background—states are implied to be conservative and consistent. Consistency Map: identical grey for meta/dates in both left and center columns; same accent logic across right column widgets; dark side gutters balance the page and keep values stable edge‑to‑edge. Failure Theme: minimal visibility of hover/visited color states due to single screenshot. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 18’s tuned neutrals and sparse accent; slightly less playful accent usage than Exemplar 16, but equally disciplined. Score Justification: Harmonious, controlled palette with clear role logic merits 4; lack of multi‑state evidence holds back from 5.

typography.explanation: Observations: Left sidebar navigation shows small, muted items with the active state in a darker tone/italic. Main column uses a single sans family with a clear H1 ('Shu Ding') above well-spaced paragraphs. Inline links are underlined and consistently styled across multiple paragraphs. Reconstruction (Type Scale): H1 ≈ 1.5–1.7× body with added top/bottom spacing; body measure ≈60–70ch and line-height ~1.5–1.6; sidebar uses a reduced size for tertiary labels, indicating a controlled scale. Readability: Off‑black text on a soft white background and generous leading make long paragraphs comfortable. Consistency: Links inside paragraphs share the same thin underline/offset and muted blue; paragraph spacing is uniform; punctuation and rags look tidy with no widows. Micro‑craft signals: 1) Comfortable 60–70ch measure; 2) Generous, even paragraph spacing; 3) Thin, well‑offset link underlines; 4) Off‑black body color for reduced glare; 5) Sidebar typographic down‑weighting for hierarchy; 6) Clean rags without hyphenation collisions. Link/State Audit: Active nav state handled via tone/italic; inline links consistently underlined (hover states not visible but style repeats). Consistency Map: repeated underline/link color in two paragraphs; repeated paragraph rhythm; repeated sidebar item sizing/spacing. Failure Theme: limited breadth—few levels beyond H1/body; no visible hover/focus proof. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 18 (Paco Coursey) and Exemplar 16 (Gavin Nelson). Deltas vs anchors: fewer scale steps (no subheads/captions), less state variety shown, and narrower evidence. Score Justification: Strong editorial minimal typography with disciplined rhythm; single‑view evidence but ≥4 micro‑signals justify 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: A two‑column structure—narrow left navigation separated by a light vertical rule and a comfortable main content column. Content paragraphs align to a consistent left edge; right margin breathes. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Sidebar ≈15–20% width, content column ~640–720px with even 8/16px rhythm; vertical rule anchors the split and maintains a clean reading path. Paragraph blocks stack on a stable vertical rhythm; sidebar items are evenly spaced. Image handling N/A, but the text layout is disciplined. Micro‑craft signals: 1) Clear two‑column grid with a vertical rule; 2) Consistent content width across the page; 3) Even vertical spacing between nav items and between paragraphs; 4) Balanced outer margins with ample right whitespace; 5) Active nav aligns with H1 top baseline establishing a visual starting point. Link/State Audit: Links are inline and don’t break alignment; nav state handled structurally (position and style) rather than floating CTAs. Consistency Map: repeated sidebar item spacing, repeated paragraph stack rhythm, repeated left alignment across columns. Failure Theme: Limited asset variety—no project tiles or screenshots to stress the system. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 18/16’s restrained editorial shells; deltas are less breadth (no cards/tiles) and fewer alignment challenges. Score Justification: Strong, quiet composition with consistent rhythm; single‑view but with multiple micro‑signals, merits 4.

color.explanation: Observations: Palette is neutral-first—off‑white background, off‑black text, cool gray divider; a single muted blue accent for links. Sidebar text uses lighter gray to de‑emphasize inactive items while the active item is darker. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Neutral shell keeps focus on copy; divider tint and sidebar grays form a clear value ladder. Link/CTA roles: inline links use the same blue and underline; nav state relies on tone rather than additional hues. Micro‑craft signals: 1) Off‑black text rather than pure #000; 2) Muted blue accent with adequate contrast; 3) Consistent gray divider and sidebar tones; 4) Minimal palette that reduces value flicker; 5) Accent is sparse and limited to links. Link/State Audit: Inline links show a single role; nav state is indicated by tonal change—consistent state logic. Consistency Map: same blue across multiple links, same gray rule throughout, same sidebar tonality across items. Failure Theme: Very conservative—no hover/visited proof and no imagery to test unification. Anchor Comparison: Near Exemplar 18/16 in restraint; slightly less sophisticated because states and mat harmonization aren’t demonstrated. Score Justification: Controlled, harmonious neutrals with a disciplined single accent warrant 4 given the clean execution, despite limited scope.

typography.explanation: Observations: Hero 'Hi, I’m Saebom!' in a clean geometric sans with comfortable whitespace; section headers ('Selected Work', 'About', 'Fun') repeat consistently; project titles with small tag chips and pill CTAs; experience rows use a lighter body with date column. Across the project tiles and about section the body copy remains readable with adequate contrast. Reconstruction (Type Scale): H1 ~40–48px, H2 ~22–24px, body ~14–16px with ~1.4–1.6 leading; sentence‑case used; no default link blue or underlines. Baseline rhythm appears stable and paragraph spacing is even. Link/State Audit: CTAs are black filled rounded pills; secondary small pills ('Read more', 'Contact me') are consistently styled—states not shown but affordance is clear. Consistency Map: repeated rounded pill CTAs; consistent section titling; uniform chip style for company; same sans throughout. Failure Theme: generic voice with limited micro‑craft (no tuned link underlines, no visible small‑caps/number alignment work; some tiny captions on tiles compete with imagery). Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 19 and Exemplar 8. Compared to those, this page shows similar readable sans and spacing but less refined caption hierarchy and link/state detailing, and fewer micro‑tuned touches. layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Long single‑column list of large project tiles with consistent rounded rectangles; about section splits image/text into a tidy two‑column; experience list uses aligned rows with dividers; a small photo grid closes the page. However, all project tiles use laptop/device frames where the UI is too small to read. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Primary container is centered with comfortable margins; vertical rhythm between sections is even; project titles sit above each tile with right‑aligned pill links that occasionally feel detached from the main column. Image handling: device frames over blurred office backdrops repeat. Link/State Audit: CTAs are consistently placed near titles but alignment to the grid is loose. Consistency Map: 1) Repeated device‑in‑blurred‑background tile; 2) matching corner radii across assets; 3) even section spacing; 4) uniform pill CTAs. Failure Theme: device‑mock collage with tiny, unreadable UI reduces comprehension of the work; assets are decorative rather than informative. Preflight Checklist: 4+ sloppy cues from unreadable UI inside device frames across multiple tiles; triggers red_flag 'sloppy_images' and enforces Layout ≤ 2. Anchor Comparison: Compared to Exemplar 19 and Exemplar 8, this page has weaker asset presentation (readable screenshots and harmonized mats there vs small, ornamental mocks here) and looser CTA alignment. color.explanation: Observations: Neutral shell (white background, off‑black text) with black filled CTAs and light gray chips; blurred background photos behind device frames introduce warm/cool tones; grayscale travel photos help keep the footer calm. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Primary roles—black pills for actions, gray chips for meta, black text—are consistent; no default link blue. The varied blurred backgrounds introduce some value variance but the overall page remains readable. Consistency Map: 1) White page chrome; 2) black action pill buttons; 3) gray meta chips; 4) monochrome photography at the end. typography.explanation: Preflight: template cues low (custom editorial hero, no boilerplate sections); sloppy cues ≈2 (some small, unreadable UI text in the Discord Communities and Airbase collages). Observations: Editorial serif headings like “Discord Mobile Redesign,” “Blitz,” “Witeboard,” and “Airbase” repeat across sections; body copy in a clean sans with comfortable measure; right-column meta set in small caps/light weight appears consistently. Reconstruction — Type Scale: H1 editorial hero; H2 project titles with generous size; body ~14–16px with ~1.5 leading; meta micro-labels smaller with tracking. Readability: ample whitespace and off-black text on off‑white provide comfortable contrast; paragraphs sit 60–75ch. Consistency: same serif/sans pairing, repeated title size/weight, consistent right-aligned meta treatment, stable spacing between title, dek, and artwork. Micro‑craft: optical alignment of titles with image blocks; consistent en/em dash use in meta; tidy rags. Link/State Audit: CTAs/links appear understated and consistent (subtle text links near titles and footer), though states aren’t directly demonstrable from the single screenshot. layout_composition.explanation: Preflight: no template scent; sloppy images under threshold (two small, less-readable UI tiles). color.explanation: Preflight: no mismatched whites causing flicker; gradients are intentional; no noisy logo rows. typography.explanation: Preflight notes: Sloppy cues (1): tiny unreadable UI inside a phone mock. Template cues (1): centered “I’m a Product Designer …” hero. Observations: 1) Top nav with small sans links (Work/Writing/About). 2) Centered intro line with inline blue links (e.g., Bugcrowd, Contact me). 3) Section header “Featured work” larger, followed by a small meta line. 4) Minimal footer line. Micro‑craft: no tuned underlines or visible state changes; limited nuance in punctuation spacing or baseline rhythm, but nothing broken. Weaker than Exemplar 19’s tuned scale and polished captions; stronger than a raw template because spacing and measures are stable. layout_composition.explanation: Preflight notes: Sloppy cues (1): phone mock with unreadable UI. Template cues (1): centered intro hero. Observations: 1) Single-column centered container with even left/right gutters. 2) Two large project tiles stacked with consistent widths and margins. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Simple one-column flow; consistent section spacing; tiles align to container; captions/meta sit predictably. Image handling: first tile is a collage on a dark mat; second is a phone mock on a light blue mat—both cleanly cropped but the device UI is too small to read. Link/State Audit: links positioned logically within text; no stray floating CTAs. Consistency Map: repeated full-width tiles, uniform outer gutters, stable vertical spacing, centered headings. Failure Theme: asset presentation lacks unification (different mats/illustration styles) and the device mock sacrifices readability; overall structure is generic. color.explanation: Preflight notes: No mismatched whites causing severe flicker; one sloppy cue (small device UI). Observations: neutral white page with black/near‑black text; links use a standard blue; project tiles introduce strong hues (dark navy/indigo background on the first, pale blue/teal on the second). Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Shell is neutral with a single accent from link blue; no visible hover/visited states; tiles rely on their own artwork colors; no border tints or subtle shadows to unify. The two project backgrounds create mild value/hue jumps but remain contained. Consistency Map: consistent neutral shell, same link color across hero and meta line, images confined to tiles. Failure Theme: default blue accent and lack of mat/border strategy mean imagery isn’t harmonized; color system feels serviceable rather than designed. Anchor Comparison: Close to Exemplar 8 (neutral shell + default-ish blue). Less tuned than Exemplar 19 where mats/illustrations are value‑matched and cohesive. typography.explanation: Observations: Dark hero with large sans headline “I am Jiyoung,” compact paragraph, small outlined button. Project grid uses small captions (project title + company) below thumbnails; top-right nav shows light-weight labels. Reconstruction: Single grotesk/neo‑grotesk family (Inter/Roboto-like). Scale appears consistent (H1 ≈ 44–56, body ≈ 16, captions ≈ 12–13). Line height is comfortable and rags are clean; no collisions. Hierarchy is primarily size+weight; captions use lighter tone for meta. Link/State Audit: Only one clear CTA (outlined button) and a “See projects” anchor with a chevron; no visible underline/hover state system across sections. Consistency Map: (1) Repeated caption style below all tiles, (2) same body type across hero and captions, (3) consistent lightweight nav labels. Failure Theme: Template voice—generic system sans, lack of custom link treatment or typographic point of view; no visible micro‑craft such as tuned underlines or small‑caps. Preflight (template cues): “I am [Name]” hero, left‑text/right‑visual hero, down‑arrow prompt. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 8 and 19; compared to 19, this shows comparable rhythm but less state/underline polish and a more generic voice; cleaner than 8’s roughness. Score Justification: Readable and orderly but generic; template_scent_high caps Typography ≤ 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Hero uses a two‑column split (text/animation) with ample breathing room. Below, a two‑column project grid with consistent left alignment and even gutters; each tile has a caption. Crops look clean; shadows are restrained. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): Single centered container; two‑column masonry with predictable gutters; vertical rhythm is steady from section to section. Image handling mixes plain screenshots with one device collage (iMac/iPad/iPhone) on a gray mat. Link/State Audit: Primary CTA fixed in hero; the “See projects” anchor visually guides scroll but other tiles lack hover/state cues. Consistency Map: (1) Two‑column grid repeated across rows, (2) consistent caption placement, (3) repeated shadow/mat treatment per tile. Failure Theme: Template structure with limited point of view; value flicker from mixed mats (gray vs white) and from white vs dark UI thumbnails; some thumbnails are too zoomed‑out to read at this size. Preflight: Template cues ≥3 (I‑am hero, left text/right visual, down arrow, uniform grid) → template_scent_high flag and cap Layout ≤ 3. Anchor Comparison: Similar to Exemplar 8 (two‑column, disciplined spacing); weaker asset unification than Exemplar 19. Score Justification: Solid baseline grid and spacing but clearly templated and with minor asset inconsistencies; capped at 3.

color.explanation: Observations: Deep green‑black hero with white text; content area shifts to white background. Thumbnails introduce their own palettes (dark Netflix UIs, bright Adobe boards). One tile sits on a gray mat with device frames; others sit on white, causing value variance. Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): Neutral set is conservative (white page, near‑black hero). Accent logic is minimal—outlined button stroke and subtle chevron; no visible link color system. Unification tactics (consistent mats/border tints) are limited, so colorful/gray tiles aren’t harmonized. Link/State Audit: No clear, repeated link color/hover system; CTA color role is understated but not reinforced elsewhere. Consistency Map: (1) Hero’s monochrome scheme is consistent within the section, (2) captions keep low‑contrast gray for meta, (3) shadows are similarly soft. Failure Theme: Value flicker from mixed mats (gray vs white) and dark vs light UIs; lack of a defined accent to bind the gallery. Anchor Comparison: Close to Exemplar 8/19—serviceable neutrals, but fewer unifying tactics than stronger anchors. typography.explanation: Observations: 1) Large, confident headline block under the hero image; 2) Clear H2 'Projects' and consistent project captions with small meta lines; 3) About section on black uses the same family with tidy column lists; 4) Links (e.g., Allbirds and Press items) use a thin, tuned black underline rather than default blue. Reconstruction: Type Scale — Display H1 (~2.5–3x body), H2 for section labels, small body/meta for captions; leading appears ~1.4–1.5, comfortable. Readability — measures are reasonable (headline wide but controlled; captions ~55–70ch), contrast strong on both white and black backgrounds. Consistency — casing is sentence/title‑case consistently; link treatment (color + underline thickness/offset) repeats in hero and press list; baseline rhythm feels stable across sections. Micro‑craft — underline weight/offset looks tuned; no widows/orphans in visible blocks; punctuation/spacing reads clean. Link/State Audit: Links are consistently black with a fine underline; button label 'Contact' reads with appropriate weight; states not shown but implied consistently. Consistency Map: repeated underline style (hero + press), consistent section label style (Projects + About), repeated small meta style under project tiles. Failure Theme: minor—body/caption size leans small; limited variety of typographic voices and no visible link hover/visited states. Preflight: sloppy cues 0; template cues 0; no caps triggered. Anchor Comparison: Closest to Exemplar 1 (balanced editorial minimal) and Exemplar 19; deltas—fewer text styles and states than Ex1, more photography‑led than Ex19. Score Justification: Strong, disciplined typography with minor gaps on states/scale variety merits 4.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: 1) Full‑bleed hero photo followed by a left‑aligned text block with generous breathing room; 2) Projects section uses a 3‑column grid with even gutters and aligned captions; 3) About section switches to a black panel with a balanced split: large photo left, structured lists right, and a small 'Contact' button aligned to the grid. Reconstruction: Grid/Spacing — consistent content width; 3‑column project grid with equal ratios, captions align to a shared left edge; vertical rhythm between sections is even; About section shows a clear two‑column layout and stable margins. Image handling — photo crops feel intentional; tile edges/radii look unified; no cut‑off or unreadable assets. Reading path — hero image > statement > projects grid > about; hierarchy is clear and scannable. Link/State Audit: Captions and links consistently placed below images; CTA isolated in About for clear affordance. Consistency Map: repeated edge margins across sections, identical project tile structure and caption placement, consistent section headings. Failure Theme: conservative; 'Contact' button feels slightly floaty in the black panel and grid POV is standard rather than distinctive. Preflight: sloppy cues 0; template cues 0; no caps. Anchor Comparison: Near Exemplar 1 and Exemplar 17 (image‑led grids); deltas—shorter page and fewer modules than Ex17; less structural novelty than Ex1. Score Justification: Cohesive, well‑paced grid and careful image handling with minor roughness justifies 4.

color.explanation: Observations: 1) Monochrome shell (black/white) lets vibrant footwear photography carry accent; 2) About section uses a deep black panel to create a clear sectional break; 3) Links are black with thin underlines; 4) Contact button on black uses a light gray chip for contrast. Reconstruction: Unification & State Logic — neutral shell keeps diverse photos coherent; black panel provides structural contrast without clashing; link/CTA roles are readable (text links vs subtle button). Neutrals are crisp and consistent; no noisy logo rows. Link/State Audit: Links rely on underline role consistently; button state logic not shown but color roles are clear. Consistency Map: repeated black text/underline links (hero + press), repeated white background for content tiles, consistent black panel treatment for About. Failure Theme: relies on pure #000/#fff rather than tuned neutrals; states (hover/active) not demonstrated; occasional value jump from saturated photography to pure black is noticeable but controlled. Preflight: sloppy cues 0; template cues 0; no caps. Anchor Comparison: Close to Exemplar 19 (neutral shell + imagery); behind Exemplar 5 on nuanced neutral tuning. Score Justification: Harmonious, disciplined palette with clear roles; minor tuning gaps keep it at 4.

typography.explanation: Observations: Large all‑caps hero name with generous tracking on a maroon textured banner; small, clean sans in nav (WORK/PLAY/ABOUT); project captions show left label + one‑line description + right‑aligned year; footer uses a casual "Let's chat!" subhead and underlined text links. Preflight notes: sloppy cues = 2 (unreadable UI inside two device mocks); template cues = 2 (big name hero; 'Made in Framer' badge). Reconstruction: Type Scale—H1 very large display all‑caps; captions/body around a comfortable small sans; subhead in footer slightly larger. Readability—body/caption measure looks ~60–70ch where present; leading is adequate and contrast is fine on white. Consistency—caption pattern repeats across all three projects; nav and footer link styles appear consistent (simple underlines). Micro‑craft—baseline alignment of captions is stable; year consistently right‑aligned; however the default‑ish link styling and over‑tracked all‑caps hero feel generic rather than tuned (no evidence of custom underline thickness/offset or refined small‑caps). Link/State Audit: Links are plain underlined text; no hover/active/visited state evidence; nav active state not clearly signaled. Consistency Map: repeated caption structure across three tiles; consistent nav tone; repeated use of sentence‑case captions; right‑aligned year. Failure Theme: Generic sans with default link treatment and over‑reliance on a large, spaced all‑caps hero limits typographic voice. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchor = candidate_33 (3/3/3). Similar clarity and competence; unlike exemplars 5/6 (stronger rhythm and tuned links), this page lacks refined link states and modular scale sophistication. Score Justification: Clear, readable, and consistent but not notably refined; with limited evidence and preflight cues below thresholds, 3 is appropriate.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Single‑column stack with consistent tile width and even vertical spacing; each project tile is a collage with textured mats and tape motifs; captions align cleanly beneath tiles; bottom footer splits into two columns. Preflight notes: sloppy cues = 2 due to small, unreadable UI inside phone frames on the first and second tiles; template cues = 2 (nameplate hero and 'Made in Framer' badge) but below cap threshold. Reconstruction: Grid/Spacing—centered container (~1100–1200px); one‑column layout; consistent gutters between hero, tiles, and footer; captions sit on a unified baseline with left label/right year lockup. Reading path is straightforward top‑to‑bottom. Assets—crops are clean; device frames are small which hurts legibility but not alignment; collage backgrounds vary per tile by intent. Link/State Audit: Project tiles show minimal affordance (tiny arrow on first tile only); overall clickable structure is not strongly signaled. Consistency Map: identical tile width across 3 projects; caption structure repeats; footer uses a simple two‑column grid; nav is minimal and aligned to page margins. Failure Theme: Emphasis on decorative collage causes value variation and weak affordance; device mocks are too small to read, reducing perceived polish. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchor = candidate_33 (3/3/3). Unlike exemplar 5 (5 in layout), this page lacks rigorous multi‑column systems and harmonized mats/radii across a large gallery. Score Justification: Competent, clean rhythm and alignment, but no standout structural POV and some readability issues in imagery; stays at 3.

color.explanation: Observations: Maroon hero banner with a playful green patterned strip; each tile uses earth‑tone paper textures (beige/green/red) behind screenshots; text sits on white with dark gray/black; footer remains neutral. Preflight notes: no value cap triggers, but there is mild value flicker from varied collage backgrounds; template cues below threshold. Reconstruction—Unification & State Logic: Palette mixes warm maroon/greens with neutral paper tones; the shell (white page, dark text) stays consistent; link color appears default/dark with underlines; no clear CTA color system or hover states visible. Integration with imagery: UCLA tile’s bright blue UI stands out but is still contained; varied mats create intentional personality but also introduce uneven values. Link/State Audit: Links rely on underline; state roles are not shown. Consistency Map: maroon appears in hero and some tile backgrounds; green recurs in patterned strip and third tile; captions keep neutral text throughout. Failure Theme: Decorative mats add charm but create value variance without a clear accent/state system; links/CTAs lack defined color roles. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchor = candidate_33 (3/3/3). Unlike exemplars 2/5 (strong tuned neutrals and accent discipline), this page uses color more decoratively than systematically. Score Justification: Harmonious and pleasant, but not systematized; remains baseline 3.

typography.explanation: Preflight findings: few text elements on page; most tiles are images with embedded, inconsistent type; link/hover states not demonstrated. Observations: header shows a small wordmark 'Sunny Babbar' at top‑left with two plain links 'Portfolio' and 'About' top‑right. Project tiles have no captions; several tiles include on‑image text (e.g., LinkedIn slide, poster 'DON'T LISTEN TO HER') that doesn’t establish a site‑level type system. Reconstruction: Type Scale – effectively only a nameplate (~20–24px) and nav links (~14–16px). No visible H1/H2 body scale, no captions or meta styles; paragraphs absent. Readability – nav is legible, but there is no body copy to judge measure/leading. Consistency – link styling appears plain black text with no underline or state; lack of captions means no repeated typographic modules. Micro‑craft – no evidence of tuned baselines, underline thickness/offset, or punctuation spacing. Link/State Audit: only two nav links; states are not visible and there’s no consistent link treatment across tiles because most are images. Consistency Map: repeated elements are (1) small wordmark, (2) right‑aligned nav, (3) two‑column image grid. None create typographic rhythm. Failure Theme: the portfolio relies on image tiles, so a typographic system is essentially missing. Anchor Comparison: closest anchors are Exemplar 20 and Exemplar 8; those show clearer text structures and captions. This page lacks headings/captions, link states, and any visible scale system. Score Justification: with single‑view evidence and absent system hierarchy, Typography stays below the competent baseline at 2.

layout_composition.explanation: Preflight findings: 1) multiple unreadable small‑UI device mocks (two tall chat screens, laptop+phone duo, tablet+phone set, and triple orange phone screens) → sloppy cue; 2) irregular masonry rhythm/ragged row bottoms; 3) mismatched internal mats/device frames. Observations: the page uses a two‑column gallery of mixed‑ratio tiles. Rows do not align vertically; the oversized 'bud.com' tile and a full‑bleed architectural photo create lopsided weight. Several device frames contain tiny, unreadable UI. Reconstruction: Grid/Spacing – two columns with a moderate gutter; varying tile heights break vertical rhythm; captions are absent; clickable affordances are unclear. Image handling – heterogeneous assets (slides, logos, device renders, photography) with inconsistent radii, mats, and angles produce a collage effect. Link/State Audit: no clear CTAs or hover states; tiles likely clickable but affordance is not signaled. Consistency Map: (1) two‑column grid, (2) edge‑to‑edge tiles, (3) repeated device‑in‑mock images. Breakdowns: inconsistent aspect ratios, uneven vertical spacing, and tiny UI inside devices. Failure Theme: masonry collage with harmonization issues and unreadable mocks. Anchor Comparison: closest to Exemplar 20; this page is weaker due to ragged rows, multiple small unreadable device mocks, and no unified asset treatment. Score Justification: sloppy_images threshold is met, which caps Layout at ≤2; the observed rhythm and asset issues align with a 2.

color.explanation: Preflight findings: value/white‑balance mismatch across tiles (dark gray logo tile, beige LinkedIn slide, bright orange app screens, deep‑black poster, saturated blue‑sky photo) creates value flicker → pulls Color down. Observations: the shell is stark white with black text and no visible accent system. Tiles bring disparate palettes that clash in value and temperature. Reconstruction – Unification & State Logic: no tuned neutrals (reads like pure #fff/#000), no mats/border tints to harmonize screenshots, and no visible link/CTA color logic. Link/State Audit: nav links use neutral text; states not shown. Consistency Map: (1) white page background, (2) black text, (3) colorful tiles—yet there is no chromatic logic to unify them. Failure Theme: color is driven by the artwork of each project; lack of mats or tinted frames causes severe value flicker. Anchor Comparison: closest to Exemplar 20; ours is rougher due to bigger value jumps (dark poster adjacent to bright sky photo) and no neutral tuning. Score Justification: mismatched whites/mats trigger Color ≤2; given the unmanaged collage feel, 2 is appropriate.

typography.explanation: Observations: Centered hero with a very large bold headline; small gray intro copy under it. Section label 'Selected work' and project titles + short descriptions repeat down the page. Brand tags (e.g., MARQETA) appear as small caps above titles. Preflight: sloppy cues noted separately; template cues 2 — 'I'm [Name]' hero and boilerplate footer. Reconstruction (Type Scale): Display H1 is oversized relative to the rest; H2/section labels are tiny causing a steep drop; body appears ~14–16px with fairly tight leading; meta/labels vary in weight (all‑caps label vs Title) but the spacing rhythm between title/desc is not clearly modular. Readability: comfortable but generic; hero contrast is fine, subtext feels a bit low‑contrast and airy. Consistency: Links and states are unclear (only a coral 'Contact' pill up top; 'See all work' looks like a plain text link with no tuned underline). Micro‑craft: No visible underline tuning; all‑caps labels not optically tracked; no evidence of number alignment or baseline tuning. Consistency Map: (1) Title + one‑line description pattern repeats per project; (2) small brand tag above title; (3) generous top/bottom section spacing. Failure Theme: Generic Inter/Roboto‑like setup with an overscaled hero and minimal state craft; hierarchy relies on size alone. Anchor Comparison: Closest anchor is Exemplar 3 (identical page). Deltas are negligible; matches anchor’s junior typographic voice. Score Justification: Adequate legibility but weak hierarchy balance, limited link/state system, and little micro‑craft → 2.

layout_composition.explanation: Observations: Simple single‑column page; large image block followed by title/description; images are renders (angled devices, stacked browser windows, iPhone) with generous mats. Spacing is even and containers stay consistent. Preflight: sloppy cues ≥3 — multiple device mocks where UI text is unreadable at presented size (angled collage, stacked windows, iPhone shot); device‑frame collage with tiny UI. Reconstruction (Grid/Spacing): One centered container (~720–840px), consistent vertical rhythm; no complex grids; captions left‑aligned under images; nav is sparse. Link/State Audit: Only top‑right coral button is clearly actionable; project tiles aren’t obviously interactive; no hover/pressed logic visible. Consistency Map: (1) Image then caption block repeated; (2) uniform container width and gutters; (3) thin separators of whitespace between sections. Failure Theme: Image handling prioritizes glossy 3D device renders over readable product UI; the page reads as a clean template with limited structural decisions. Anchor Comparison: Matches Exemplar 3; the same strengths (clean rhythm) and issues (unreadable mocks, template feel). Score Justification: Sloppy‑images cap applies (Layout ≤2). Even without the cap, the structure is competent but templated with clarity loss from unreadable assets → 2.

color.explanation: Observations: White page chrome with very dark navy/black headlines; a coral pill for 'Contact'; project imagery introduces varied mats (pale blue/gray) and saturated blues in charts plus a dark‑mode phone. Preflight: no value‑flicker cap, but several tiles inject disparate palettes (brand tags in different hues, dark iPhone). Reconstruction (Unification & State Logic): No clear accent role beyond the lone coral button; links elsewhere lack a consistent color/state language; neutrals appear close to pure #fff/#111 with little hue‑shift in borders/shadows; image mats alternate between white, pale gray, and soft blue without strong unification. Link/State Audit: No visible hover/visited conventions; CTA is coral but this role isn’t reused. Consistency Map: (1) White chrome; (2) occasional pale blue/gray mats; (3) brand‑colored labels above project titles. Failure Theme: Default‑leaning neutrals with assorted brand and render colors causing value and hue noise; accent system isn’t defined beyond the single coral element. Anchor Comparison: Same as Exemplar 3, which scores very low on color control; issues align. Score Justification: Minimal, default‑ish palette with inconsistent unification and unclear state logic → 1.
